simona.headline: Elegance, Comfort, and a Taste of Adventure
simona.description: SIMONA is the perfect choice for those seeking a balance between sailing performance and home comfort on the water. This Lagoon 400 S2 model is famous for its bright, spacious salon and stability, making it ideal for both experienced sailors and families with children.
highlights: Spaciousness and Light: Thanks to large windows and thoughtful design, the salon is filled with natural light, creating a cozy atmosphere.
Full Autonomy: Equipped with a powerful Watermaker, this yacht allows you to enjoy long journeys without the need to frequently visit ports for water supplies.
All-Weather Comfort: The Air Conditioning (AC) system ensures a pleasant breeze during hot Mediterranean afternoons.
Relaxation Areas: The wide trampoline net at the bow is the favorite spot for sunbathing and dolphin watching.
simona.tagline: SIMONA is more than just a ship â€“ it is your floating villa for an unforgettable journey.

wide-dream.headline: Luxury Relaxation and Panoramic Views
wide-dream.description: WIDE DREAM defines the meaning of premium catamaran relaxation. The Lagoon 450 Flybridge version is built for those who refuse to compromise. With three levels of relaxation areas and impressive space, this yacht ensures privacy and luxury even for larger groups of up to 12 people.
highlights: Exclusive Flybridge: The upper-level bridge not only makes maneuvering easier but offers the best sunbathing spot with a 360-degree view of the horizon.
Highest Level of Comfort: Features a Teak deck, a Generator for continuous power, and dedicated climate control in every cabin.
Built for Entertainment: The spacious cockpit and salon areas are perfect for sunset dinners or celebrations with friends.
Premium Equipment: From a high-quality galley fridge to modern water entertainment options â€“ everything is set for high-end service.
wide-dream.tagline: With WIDE DREAM, every morning begins with a dream view and flawless comfort.

whatAre.title: What are Cookies?
whatAre.description: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) when you visit our website. They help improve your user experience by remembering your preferences and enabling certain website features.

essential.title: Essential/Technical Cookies
essential.description: These cookies are necessary for website navigation and security. They enable basic functions such as page navigation and access to secure areas of the website. The website cannot function properly without these cookies.

analytical.title: Analytical Cookies
analytical.description: We use analytical cookies (e.g., Google Analytics) to measure website traffic and understand how visitors interact with our site. This helps us improve our charter services and user experience. These cookies collect anonymous, aggregated data.

managing.title: Managing Cookies
managing.description: You can block or delete cookies through your browser settings. Here's how to manage cookies in popular browsers:
managing.chrome: Google Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data
managing.safari: Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Cookies and website data
managing.firefox: Mozilla Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data

consent.title: Consent
consent.description: By continuing to browse our website, you accept the use of essential cookies necessary for the website's functionality. For analytical cookies, we will request your explicit consent where required by law.

flag.description: As of August 2025, all commercial charter vessels operating in Spanish waters are required to display the International 'H' Flag. This flag indicates that the vessel is operating as a commercial charter service and complies with Spanish Maritime Regulations (Lista 6Âª).
flag.note: All vessels in our fleet are fully compliant with this 2026 regulatory requirement.

manifest.title: Passenger Manifest & Official Logbook
manifest.description: In accordance with 2026 Spanish maritime regulations, we maintain an official passenger logbook (Manifiesto de pasajeros) for all charters. The following information is required from each passenger:
manifest.id: Valid identification document (ID card or passport)
manifest.note: This information is mandatory for safety and regulatory compliance. All data is handled in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

booking.title: Booking & Payment Terms
booking.description: To secure your charter booking, the following payment schedule applies:

deposit.title: Initial Deposit (50%)
deposit.description: A non-refundable deposit of 50% of the total charter fee is required to confirm your booking.
deposit.note: This deposit secures your selected dates and vessel.

final.title: Final Payment (30 days before departure)
final.description: The remaining 50% balance must be paid no later than 30 days before your scheduled departure date.
final.note: Failure to complete payment by this deadline may result in cancellation of your booking.

paymentMethods.title: Accepted Payment Methods
paymentMethods.bank: Bank transfer (IBAN provided upon booking confirmation)

cancellation.title: Cancellation Policy
cancellation.description: Cancellation terms vary based on the notice period before your scheduled departure:

weather.title: Weather-Related Cancellations
weather.description: In case of severe weather conditions that make sailing unsafe, the Captain has the authority to cancel or reschedule the charter. In such cases, you will be offered a full refund or the option to reschedule to alternative dates (subject to availability).
